dialogues.text: JUDE MAZZO, United States Attorney for the District of  Columbia, 45, trim, dark full hair. Hey, Jude. It's a nam you remember. It sticks in mind. Jude the Obscure. Jude Mazzo adjusts his tailored suit, crosses underground structure. The first thing you notice is the walk. The Ju walk. Something between a stroll and a strut. The balls o his feet carry his weight effortlessly; his heels follow, scrapping the concrete in precise hypnotic rhythm. The wa of confidence. His walk presumes order in the space throu which it moves, creates an allusion of order if none exis It says: this space has purpose because I am passing thro it. This isn't the confidence of unthought arrogance. It's th considered arrogance of a leader. People want order; they crave it like bread or water. Those who create order are  avatars, above judgement or suspicion. Their walk, their  bearing, the echoing sound of their approaching footsteps are manna for the masses. * Mazzo unlocks his metallic navy blue 1987 Beretta, sits in. Stereo blasts "Chantilly Lace," Big Bopper's 1959 roc hit, as he revs engine. Telephone RINGS from speakers. Th Big Bopper answers in ersatz negroid:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: * MOVING POV from inside Jude's Beretta: Justice Dept. co looms immediately ahead. Washington D.C. Capitol Dome cro the six-story skyline. The Justice Department, built 1931-35, a monumental Art D structure halfway between the Capital and the White House It's granite facade is richly decorated with columns, fri and inscriptions. Military personnel patrol the sidewalks All visitors are screened. D.C. seems under siege. Pink p sign at entrance warns: "Caution, Power Doors Swing Out." The FBI Building, 1974, Hoover's monolith, engulfs the  neighboring block. Its brutal design dwarfs human scale a feeling. SCREENWRITER'S NOTE: Special consideration is given to  architecture throughout the script. The story is set in v brave new world. Post-modern structures, such as Washingt Harbour (under construction), U.S. News, Westin and Grand hotels, are favored. International Style buildings are al prefered: L'Enfant Plaza, AFL-CIO, FBI headquarters.  Architecture of film need not be beautiful, it need only new. Historic Washington is irrelevant. Jude Mazzo's a ne creation; he needs new space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White collar workers crowd impressive corner office  overlooking Pennsylvania Avenue. No flies on this bunch:  they exude self-righteousness of underlings on the rise.  Today's idealists aching to be tomorrow's bureaucrats. A mounted Justice Dept. seal, flanked by U.S. flags, sets the tone. Grid of framed photos feature Mazzo posing with politicians past and present. Two objects stand out from government-issue decor: a bright Memphis chair and  Neoexpressionist map of D.C. Just the right hip. The office workers watch CNN. Generic NEWSCASTER speaks f by blue screen pic of smoking subway platform. Bloodied w lies in photo foreground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...The government has taken great  pains to remain calm throughout the  crisis, convinced any appearance of  panic would only encourage terrorists.  The President conducted business as  usual as pressure for action continues  to mount in the wake of the Statue  of Liberty bombing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: * CNN cuts to file footage of bleeding, frightened touris streaming from smoke-filled entrance to Statue of Liberty Paramedics and police hustle them away under glare of TV  cameras.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Rumors of the U.S. response are  the talk of Washington. This we now  know for certain: the Attorney General  will announce, perhaps as soon as  tomorrow, the formation of an ad-hoc  anti-terrorism agency, an elite inter- departmental unit headed by an anti- terrorism "czar." The name most  mentioned...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOUNG JUSTICE EMPLOYEE improvs dramatic drum roll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...is that of Jude Mazzo, the high  profile United States District  Attorney from the District of  Columbia. Steve Dunn has compiled a  background report on Attorney Mazzo.  Steve --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REPORTER DUNN narrates bio over clips from Mazzo's career They include: -- Jude as young lawyer on courthouse steps. -- Jude unveils chart of underworld crime activities. -- Jude sworn in. -- Jude, in leather jacket and jeans, tells of undercover drug buy. -- Jude receives VFW commendation. -- Jude at White House reception. -- Jude jumping from helicopter, followed by FBI. Clips cover five years. In early footage, Jude's dress an manner are bland. Later, he's the opposite: snazzy, confi charismatic.

The politicos all  stood their distance, waiting for  Mazzo to take his fall. Instead,  came a wave of convictions. Not  surprisingly, Mazzo turned his  attention to city corruption. Within  eight months, 16 state and local  officials had resigned...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mazzo's cohorts joke, wisecrack to screen. Jude's very mu a hero here -- both loved and respected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sheepish) Well, I, ah, used to know her. In  fact she and I had... a little...  affair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel smiles, impressed:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not bad. (lascivious) How was she? Good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (awkward) Well... not bad... (hesitates) Well, I wanted to know if I should  inform the agents who are on it. I  don't know, I really don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel stands without comment, terminates meeting:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleasant) Good day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attorney Gabriel escorts Mazzo to door like proud father:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it. (shakes Jude's hand) They're all watching you, Jude. You've  made quite an impression. You've got  the press like this: (cups hand) There's one thing I don't understand.  Why do you think people like you so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jude answers without hesitation, as if stating a simple f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ingenuous) I make 'em feel good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel nods, walks toward desk, turning to Jude as Mazzo exits:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The husband. It must be him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lt. Weiss watches as Mazzo packs memorabilia in Bekins bo ceremonial paperweight, photos, etc. His office is half-e stripped of non-institutional furnishings. Jude's moving NATA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure I can't help, Director?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost done. First rule of public  service: pack quick. I'll be at NATA  tomorrow. You started to brief me on  the Schreiber case -- I hate to see  my last case unsolved. It's like  leaving dirty laundry -- Milt shoulda  been here by now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know there's this jurisdictional  thing between us and FBI. Day to  day, D.C. gets nothing from the  Bureau. But come a sexy case and  they're all over us, pulling rank,  taking credit. I'm sick of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too bad you couldn't come with me to  NATA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was just that damn N.C. urine  test. Winston-Salem, 1979, with minute  traces of you-know-what -- and it's  not just me who knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (panic) It was a college thing, honest. They  said it was off the books. I know it  was --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. It's under control.  I'll just bring you in later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe me --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do. Don't apologize. (looks up) Here's Milton. (to Milt) Where were you? Lt. Weiss was bringing  me up to date on Schreiber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods to Weiss) I've already heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lt. Weiss recites report:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like you were right on the  husband. We tracked him, then Gideon  pulled rank, took him to FBI. I hear  he's babbling like a brook. Guess  what? The lab crew turned up a pale  blue thread from under the victim's  fingernail. A single strand. It must  come from the killer's tie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His tie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, his tie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scornful) First you told me the killer was  nude, in the sex act, now he's humping  nude with a blue tie on -- right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weiss and Milton, chagrined, exchange exculpatory glances

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're waiting for the thread analysis.  And there are the fingerprints, of  course. They're at FBI too. There's  nothing solid there. Only yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only mine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amber-lit in brutal majesty. FEMALE VOICE heard from with

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...surprisingly little considering  the circumstances. The victim's  prints, those of the cleaning woman,  irretrievable grease-marks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE-UP: back-lit slides of fingerprints taken from crim scene. Uninflected VOICE continues:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...perhaps the killer cleaned up,  perhaps he wore gloves --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mazzo, Gideon, Milton and Weiss flank Bryn Mawrish FBI  FINGERPRINT ANALYST, 26. Male colleagues work nearby. LFA lab is immaculate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judging from wound and bruises,  assailant is male, well-built, perhaps  short in stature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Description fits Jude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points) These are Director Mazzo's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lt. Weiss leans to examine slides:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's the shower faucet -- you turned  it on. The refrigerator handle.  Several from a drinking glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unctuous) You had a drink of water, remember,  Director? You weren't feeling well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dect. Gideon watches as Weiss and Milton vie to rationali Jude's fingerprints.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (describing slide) The telephone --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You made a call. I saw you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tape deck. You played that. (to Gideon) What about the thread? From the tie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gideon takes moment to answer:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At Fiber Analysis. They say it may  be unique, even traceable -- a long  shot. Sky blue, silk -- (to Jude) I seem to remember you were wearing  a tie like that the day of the murder.  A coincidence, but do you remember  by any chance where you bought it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gideon stares at Jude: his tone's innocent but his eyes a ice. Milton shifts uncomfortably; Weiss coughs. Jude,  oblivious, wrinkles brow:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, I can't..., I'll have to check  the label...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all moot anyway. The husband's  gonna confess. I hear it's just a  matter of time. Just like you thought,  a crime of passion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Gideon) What a disappointment for the FBI.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Weiss) A tribute to superior police work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Interrogation is heard OFF SCREEN as Jude walks through  concrete passageway, turns corner. Gideon, Milton and Wei follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mazzo enters tiny OBSERVATION ROOM, stands before one-way mirror. FBI TYPES step back as Milt and Weiss squeeze beh Jude. Framed in Interrogation Room mirror, TWO FBI INTERROGATOR grill GEORGES SCHREIBER, 42, Karin's ex-husband -- surviv of three revolutions: sexual, political, drug. He lost al three. Gideon bypasses Observation Room, enters INTERROGATION RO where Georges sits slumped in lone chair. Jude and others watch through mirror as Interrogators harrangue Georges:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you divorce your wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's be blunt. Why mince words?  Weren't you a practicing homosexual  at the time you separated from Mrs.  Schreiber?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You faggot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't she catch you taking her money  to buy little boys on P Street?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Interrogators nod to Gideon as he joins them. Georges  protests:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't like that. Don't put it  like that. I loved her. I really  did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (circling) Is that so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make up your mind. You might as well.  We know everything about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside OBSERVATION ROOM, Weiss and others watch interroga like it's a play. Milton whispers to Jude:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's trying to get sympathy. He won't  last long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Georges, you're an artist, a  decorator, a sensitive person. We'll  try to help you. Just tell us the  whole story. Slowly, calmly. Start  with the morning your wife Karin was  killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already told you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell us again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had picked up my car. I was back  on the Beltway. You couldn't get  where you were going. Traffic was  backed up, at a standstill --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In OBSERVATION ROOM, man comments:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In INTERROGATION ROOM, Georges continues:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- millions of cars. Everyone honking  their horns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Interrogator #1 snorts with disgust; #2 chuckles: Georges plaintively pans from one to other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm answering everything you ask.  I'm telling you everything Honest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tough) Hah! Not quite everything. No, you  haven't talked at all about  everything. (grabs Georges' hair) For example, you haven't talked about  how you used your wife to push your  career until she refused. You didn't  tell us that, a friend of yours told  us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OBSERVATION ROOM. Mazzo watches as Karin introduces flash

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a way to wake you up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nine months before. Jude, wearing white dress shirt and j shorts, snores face-up on sheets. Karin, in negligee, ben over him, shakes Jude's shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Third degree me. Get up, do  something. Don't sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave me alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Com'on, I like it when you question  me. You're so suspicious of me -- it  reminds me of my father. Com'on,  third degree me. Interrogate me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mazzo bolts up as Karin pushes something under his nose. stands, yanks her off bed:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, first get off the bed. Off  the bed! Now get down on your knees! (pushes her to floor) Straighten up! Straight!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jude steps to bureau, lights cigarette, sits with detache cool of experienced interrogator. Karin giggles:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The silent treatment, right? That  comes first to scare them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Straighten up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She does. Mazzo walks over, circles her closely, looking  askance like a Caesar:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now imagine the terrible hours ahead  of you. The cruel questions, the  constant tricks, the threats.  Everything. Try to recall the most  shameful, the dirtiest things you  ever did. Think about the fact that  I will discover all these secrets  because the government offers me the  means to strip you down to anything  I want. (slaps her) Straighten up! You begin to think of  all the hidden sins you've committed.  Your quilt complex takes over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (girlish) That's not frightening. Third degree  me. Be my terrorist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jude cradles her face in his hands:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to interrogate you? To  frighten you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karin nods grinning. He sharply twists her ear; she howls

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk, talk! Tell me your most shameful  secrets. Confess everything, the  little sins you commit everyday.  Then I'll forgive you and protect  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited) You treat them like babies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone becomes a child again when  confronted by official authority. By  the power that belongs to the police. (slaps her) Sit up straight! (slaps her again) Listen. Don't move. The Law. All  laws, conscious and unconscious laws,  make the accused become like a child. (demented) The accuser becomes the father, the  perfect father that cannot be  attacked, that must be pleased at  any price! (contorts expression) My face starts to be God's face to  you! It's a game staged to touch off  your deepest fears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mazzo glances at Karin's now anxious face. He picks bouqu of dried flowers from wastebasket, speaks in soothing ton

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, don't look so worried. (sits alongside) I'm trying to explain this whole  mentality because you can't see that  it's the basis, the whole foundation  of official authority. Professors,  doctors, heads of political parties,  even ticket takers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're much more like a child than  any father, believe me, you're --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jude muzzles Karin with dead bouquet mid-sentence, pushes her prone to floor:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't have said that. The  others are children. Here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jude arranges flowers around her face, says playfully:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Now I'll show you how we found  that whore in the medical office!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five sweaty Interrogators surround Georges. INTERROGATOR apprentice addition, wipes foggy glasses on sleeve. Georg Schreiber, dehydrated, maintains innocence:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I just told you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hostile) When you gonna give up that phoney  traffic jam story?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fag bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, I told you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Interrogation's getting nowhere. Gideon backs FBI boys of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay, wait, wait. Let's leave  Mr. Schreiber alone for awhile. All  by yourself. That way you can decide  what you should do. What the truth  is. The rest of you, step out with  me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Interrogators leave with Gideon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jude exits Observation Room, joins as Gideon calms  Interrogators:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's alright, take a break...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Gideon) You yell so loud. Why do you guys  yell so loud?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frustrated) I yell so loud because I learned  from you. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mazzo doesn't answer, walks into Interrogation Room. Gide waits till Jude's gone:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why doesn't he mind his own business?  He's got his own agency now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He likes to interfere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let him try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Georges, hunched over, turns as Jude squats beside chair. Mazzo offers cigarette:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A clich? -- take it anyway. (Georges does) You decorated Ambassador Arburg's  house, right? In Arlington?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Georges acknowledges as Jude lights trembling cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought so. All modern -- in a  contemporary way. (Georges flattered) Mr. Schreiber, when was the last  time you saw your wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two weeks prior to the murder. But I  was in touch cause I was being  threatened. This man. Somebody who  called.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Anonymous phone calls.  He called me late once, twice. He  had the tone of someone who commands  others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did they do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They had fun making me suffer.  Humiliating me. I'm so confused.  Maybe I did kill her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did he threaten you with? This  unknown caller?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He would say to me, "I'm gonna tell  the cops today you're a transvestite."  I think he's someone important Karin  knew. An army man maybe, I don't  know. Or, or a politician. Some people  said she was a terrorist sympathizer  but she liked any man with lots of  power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The name. Tell me what the name is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. If I did, I wouldn't  be here. That man's the murderer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (face to face) So you never knew his name? Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. The man never told it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jude offers his hand. Georges takes it, stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be getting out. Don't worry  at all about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jude walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gideon and FBI Interrogators meet Jude outside door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (effeminate) The poor boy is innocent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't mean that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise you he's innocent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Others watch as he walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only a few lights dot the nocturnal complex. Jude Mazzo's office window shines particularly bright. TH others have gone appropriately home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jude listens to cheap tape cassette player as he does sit ups. He's alone with moment of truth:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "At 10 a. m., May 7, I entered the  apartment of Karin Schreiber and  killed her. Her murder was  premeditated..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overlapping) ...meditated...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "...There is only one extenuating  circumstance."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIMECUT. Later. Jude, in black suit and tie, sits at desk Cassette player continues:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "The victim systematically..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...made a laughing-stock of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "...I left clues everywhere not  purposely to sidetrack the  investigation..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jude cuts off tape, continues confession from memory, his arms swinging:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Not purposely to sidetrack the  investigation but to prove the case.  To prove the case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jude restarts cassette:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "I left clues everywhere, not  purposely to sidetrack the  investigation, but to prove the case.  To prove the case."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To prove the case. To prove the case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mazzo rewinds, restarts recording:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "To prove the case. To prove the  case. The case that I am a man  completely above suspicion."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jude rewinds, echos confession from memory, his arms swin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...that I am a man completely above  suspicion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "...It was an idea that took control  of me. There were..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tape pause) ...extenuating circumstances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mazzo, clutching bulky 8x14 envelope, walks briskly acros L'Enfant Plaza in south Washington. Square red granite  structures enclose sterile courtyard. I.M. Pei's Internat Style complex is empty by night, eerie as Ozymandias. Jude passes fountain lit by yellow globes, stops outside  Postal Service West Building; he places stamped/addressed enevelope in mail box, enters deluxe L'Enfant Plaza Hotel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jude dials from phone cubicle in deserted ostentatious  "concourse." He hovers over receiver, places handkerchief mouth as call RINGS in earpiece. Sam Zegner, hotshot repo from scene 30, answers sleepily:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disguises voice) Sam Zegner? Crime desk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, who's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't tell you who this is. They've  got my phone tapped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this a joke or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen. D.C. Homicide will tomorrow  receive an envelope containing the  necklace of the murdered woman Karin  Schreiber, the killer's razor blade.  That rules out the husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you trying to disguise your  voice? I recognized you right away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jude quickly hangs up, heart pounding, face flushed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATA's nerve center is fully operational. Rows of isolate young men and women work silently in computer cubicles. S replay wiretap tapes on headphones; others enter data, ta notes. Jude and Alan check out cubicles as they stride toward  supercomputer. Pretty programmer in Fair Isle sweater gla at Jude flirtatiously, returns to monitor. Victor and Com Technician work at Big Moma console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Alan) ...if the government doesn't attack  terrorism, pornography, drugs, who  will? The Civil Liberties Union? The  press? The ASPCA? Of course we have  personal rights -- society has greater  rights! Society has the right to  defend itself by whatever means  necessary. Whatever means necessary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mazzo interrupts Victor:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The new taps should be in -- huh,  Victor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About half, Director, but please,  don't take on more taps without  additional staff. We're backlogged.  We just label and file most of them.  Look --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vic punches out successive screens of coded info: phone  numbers, initials, dates, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are just the current taps.  There's a million hours in storage,  known but to God. We pulled and  collated the Ria Maled taps you  wanted. About 30 hours. The most  recent two days ago. They're in your  office. Great office, by the way,  Director.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VOICE calls "Director Mazzo." Jude turns as Lt. Weiss  approaches, tabloid in hand. Avery Milton follows at dist Weiss catches his breath:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The killer went to the press. They  were tipped before we got the evidence --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (enthused) The reporter's home phone was on  your tap list. Can you believe such  luck? They're locating it now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jude just nods, walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mazzo's new office is even hipper than last: Casa Vogue w to wall. Memphis chair, painted D.C. map, framed photos a faded pennant are integrated into Neo-Classical decor. On wall's inexplicably barren. Jude examines log as phone wiretap plays on cassette deck Weiss and Milton, standing, listen to Ria Maled speak bad audio with young Hispanic later known as Tomas:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ria, where have you been? I've been  trying to reach you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was at police headquarters all  morning. They were questioning me  about Karin's murder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did they know anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, they were questioning all the  residents of the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not even that you'd slept with her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up! Don't you know my phone's  bugged? -- and now that I'm on the  point, I'd like to speak to the cops  that are listening. One cop in  particular. Comrade Officer, you  have the disgusting job of spying on  Third World liberation -- which you  call "terrorism." Give up! You're  doomed to fail --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rising) Enough! Shut it off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milton cuts off tape. Jude looks out window as Karin's VO segues to flashback:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cruel) You're disgusting. Will you throw  away that undershirt?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nine months before. Karin, nearly naked, belittles Jude a she applies mascara. He buttons white shirt over undershi pulls on black nylon socks. His shirt's worn from repeate washings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Everything you wear is impossible.  Don't worry, I won't tell your mother.  And change that shirt. You look like  a head waiter. And those little black  socks you wear like a priest. Or  like what you really are, a policeman.  Don't you have a suit with style? A  bit brighter? With some life to it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mazzo hides behind hard expression:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (curt) No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People cross the street when they  see you coming because they can tell  you're a cop. You police stink of  barracks, jails, courtrooms. Priests  at least smell like incense. They  ought to pass out a deodorant to the  police and teach them to use it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karin crosses room as Jude knots cheap black tie. She pic up scissors, approaches Jude, cuts his tie slowly. Once,  then twice. She kisses his blank face, walks to mirror. M waits to speak:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could kill you. With my own two  hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (combing hair) Who'd catch you? You'd control the  investigation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same day as previous office scene. Mazzo, Milton, Weiss a Alan listen to wiretap conversation. Jude's muffled phone voice speaks from L'Enfant lobby:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...an envelope containing the necklace  of the murdered woman Karin  Schreiber...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weiss turns to others:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen. Who does this remind you of?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam Zegner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but the other?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Where's the envelope he's talking  about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FBI.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gideon pulled rank. They were all  over us after the story hit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it either way. That proves  the husband's innocent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like you said. He'll be released.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes head) Gideon won't do it. He says he's in  charge of the case and he's holding  him and that's that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man is innocent. (walks away) Petty bureaucrat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mazzo waves off Alan:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...didn't need security before, don't  need it now! (jocular) Wouldn't I be a hell of a hostage?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jude laughs heads for assigned space where Beretta sits w and polished. Sam Zegner, lying in wait, intercepts Mazzo They inch toward Jude's metallic coupe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, what -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you read my story on the Schreiber  necklace? (Jude nods) What should I tell him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Gideon at the FBI.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him about what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants me to tell him who tipped  me about the envelope. You understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you asking me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You made that phone call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be stupid. How could I call  before the package even arrived?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you made the call!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jude stops beside Beretta, flares back at young reporter:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you ever say a thing like that!  That I call you! I never call you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (vacillates) But --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (opens door) I do favors for you, you know. So  you just watch out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam retreats as Director Mazzo sits in coupe, slams door, starts engine. Zegner's mind reels with rationalizations Jude drives down 24th. File this "Forgotten."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jude sits behind wheel in cold sweat, suddenly frightened He regulates his breathing: in-out, in-out, calming down. Jude's cool his cover? Or his turn-on? Karin's hand flashes before his face as TRAFFIC NOISE  dissolves to flashback.
